sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Handwritten letter from Schenker to Cotta, dated June 25, 1906
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: Schenker is correcting proofs of the remaining text, and asks for the missing music examples.
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: Text; Hauptwerk; main work; Korrektur; proofs; Notenbeispiel; music example; Sommerreise; summer departure; Original

tei:div.tei:p: Indem ich Ihnen dankend den Empfang des Textes (bis zum Schluß des Hauptwerkes) bestätige, dessen Korrektur ich abzuschließen im Begriffe bin,It would appear that by "text" Schenker is referring to the letterpress to the end of Part II ‒ i.e. second proofs of all the text matter ‒ but complete with music examples on location. He has previously raised this matter in CA 25, May 25, 1906, and in CA 27, June 4. ersuche ich höflichst mir nach Möglichkeit die noch fehlenden Notenbeispiele gesetzt einzuschicken,In OJ 9/31, [9], June 5, Cotta distinguished between those music examples that are set within the text, which they expect imminently, and those that are not, which they expect in early July. damit ich, wie ich schon einmal erwähnte, noch vor meiner Sommerreise in der Lage bin, denselben nach den Originalen zu revidierenThe precise date of Schenker's departure is not recorded, but his diary for July 10 (OJ 1/5, p.13) records "Sommer in Ötz in Tirol." ("Summer in Ötz in the Tyrol."). By "originals" Schenker means the scores in his personal library at Reisnerstraße 38.

I gratefully acknowledge receipt of the text (through to the end of the main work), and am in process of finishing off correcting the proofs of it. I ask you kindly to send me the music examples that are still lacking as soon as they have been set, so that, as already mentioned once before, I am in a position to check them against the originals before I leave for my Summer holidays.
